channel.title: Your doctor speaks II
channel.description:
In this series, doctors from the colleges of medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, nursing, and graduate college at the University of Illinois Medical Center in Chicago discuss the latest advances in cancer and heart research, painless dentistry, psychiatry, nursing care, modern drugs and more.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Parkinson's Disease
item.description: Dr. Louis Boshes, director of the Consultation Clinic for Epilepsy at the University of Illinois, describes Parkinson's Disease, a slowly progressive neurological illness carrying three major symptoms: rigidity, distressing and often uncontrollable tremors, and an associated loss of automatic and unconscious posture movements that are essential to normal movements.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Parkinson's Disease

item.title: The Importance of a Good Diet
item.description: A conversation with Dr. Henry Jeffay, associate professor at the University of Illinois College of Medicine at the Medical Center campus in Chicago, on the importance of a good diet.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Gum Diseases: what Can Be Done?
item.description: Our guest today is Dr. Sigmund Porter, assistant professor of periodontics at the University of Illinois College of Dentistry, on periodontics, the study of diseases in the surrounding structures of teeth. Although this may sound like a very limited area, gum disease is probably the most prevalent disease on the face of the earth.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Periodontics

item.title: Ulcers
item.description: Dr. Philip Thorek, professor of surgery at the University of Illinois College of Medicine, describes the nature, causes, and treatment of peptic ulcers.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Peptic Ulcers

item.title: Women's Special Interest in Cancer
item.description: Dr. William Mergert, professor and head of the departments of Obstetrics and Gynecology, University of Illinois, talked about women's additional risk factors in the form of breast and genital tract cancer.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Women

item.title: Prevention of Tooth Decay in Childr
item.description: A conversation about the prevention of tooth decay in children with Dr. Donald E. Ore, assistant professor of Pedodontics at the University of Illinois College of Dentistry.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Teeth--Diseases

item.title: Skin Tumors - Skin Cancer
item.description: An interview with Dr. Lawrence Solomon, assistant professor of dermatology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine, who discussed skin tumors, masses on the skin that are often made up of new tissue.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Skin--Cancer

item.title: Food Poisoning
item.description: A conversation about food poisoning with Dr. Conrad Blomquist, assistant dean of the University of Illinois College of Pharmacy and associate professor of the College of Pharmacy.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Hearing Loss in Children
item.description: A conversation about hearing loss in children with Dr. Richard E. Marcus, associate professor of otorhinolaryngology at the University of Illinois and director of the Institute of Hearing and Speech, and Dr. Lewis Tenta, senior professor of otorhinolaryngology and consultant for the hearing conservation program for the Chicago public schools.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Epilepsy: Is There a Problem?
item.description: An interview with Dr. Louis Boshes, director of the epilepsy consultation clinic at the University of Illinois Medical Center, who described the nature of epilepsy, a condition resulting from a brain malfunction.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Neurology

item.title: Juvenile Amputees
item.description: Dr. Claude Lambert, professor of orthopedic surgery at the University of Illinois and attending orthopedic surgeon at Presbyterian St. Luke's Hospital, discusses the unique challenges of treating and educating juvenile amputees to prepare them for future lives and careers.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Problems of Older People
item.description: Dr. Adrian Ostfeld, professor of preventative medicine at the University of Illinois College of Medicine, discussed the three main threats to the health of older people--heart attack, cancer, and stroke--as well as other prevalent conditions, including arthritis.
item.dc:creator: U. of Illinois Medical
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest
